sentences: Shirley Fleming (1929 in New York City â€“ 10 March 2005) was an American music critic and editor.

Born in New York City in 1929, she was the daughter of novelist Berry Fleming, who enjoyed popularity during the 1930s and 1940s with a series of successful works, and later in the 1980s with his Captain Bennett's Folly.
From 1967 to 1991, she was the editor of the magazine Musical America.
In 1965 she worked as a freelance writer for The New York Times and later was on that paper's music criticism staff from 1975 to 1978.
